The basic concept of numerical variables application is given in this manual.

   *   *   *

Dear authors! Please, adress your questions to our VK or Discord, links are below.

It is the system of variables that may replace almost all other operators and provides authors an opportunity to create really interesting and complex structure of the stories.
   What may be used this instrument for? The answer is: for everything! Indicating the character's lifebar, the quantity of various items or being the auxiliary mechanism variables are indispensable.
   The basic principles of variables use and main features of them will be discussed further.

Work of variables is based on operators, which provide interaction between the author and the program. Several operators serve to change the value of variables, others are responsible for the demonstration or for the conditions and limitations.
   These operators are to be placed in answer field and act only on the answer they are connect with. Common structure of variable operator is as follows:

var smth ["name",argument]

where "var smth" is the desired operator, "name" is the name of variable it acts on, "argument" is the number or the name of other variable which value is taken for calculation.
   Please note, that every variable name should have quotation-marks. Square brackets and commas as spacers are needed for a correct work of an operator, no other symbols are permitted.

text:
To place the variables operator on the answer you need to open an "edit answer" tool and then to type in the desired operator. If you need more than one operator on the answer you should save the first one and then reiterate with enother.
   In order to make one operator act on several variables you need to write it in the format:

var smth ["name1",argument1,"name2",argument2, ... , "nameX",argumentX]

   To delete the operator you may write:
var smth []

   Note that all variables automatically have a zero value before any operator of action has changed it.

As it was noticed before, all calculations with variables are performed only after the reader choose the answer which contains theese operators. But there is an opportunity to avoid this limitation by means of operator "calculate".
   Placed on the answer this operator transforms it into a calculation-type answer, which has several features: this answer becomes invisible for the reader and all operators on it work automatically just after the page is loaded as if the reader has choosen this answer. It may be used for a construction of complex series of calculations hidden from the reader.
   The sequence of calculations starts from the upper "calculate"-answer, so you can easily tune an order of priority for each situation by simple shift of answers position. To switch on this mode you should enter:
  calculate
into an answer field and in the same way you can disable it.
